rules.natural: Either industrial emissions cause air pollution or agricultural runoff causes water pollution.
Provided that the power plant produces emissions, pollution levels violate standards.
The power plant produces emissions or the factory produces emissions.
If the coal plant is operating, then in the event that the factory produces emissions, pollution levels violate standards.
The coal plant being compliant implies that the refinery is operating.
Should the coal plant be violating, then it is not compliant.
Either wetlands are protected or pollution levels violate standards.
Whenever the development project is proposed, it impacts habitat.
The development project requiring a permit entails that wetlands are not protected.
In the case that agricultural runoff causes water pollution, pollution levels violate standards.

The scientist publishing findings implies that, if the scientist studies pollution, then either natural weather causes air pollution or, should industrial emissions cause air pollution, pollution levels violate standards.
Either the scientist publishes findings or the scientist presents at a conference.

The scientist presenting at a conference means that, if the scientist studies pollution, then either natural weather causes air pollution or, provided that industrial emissions cause air pollution, pollution levels violate standards.
The environmental group advocating for regulation results in the environmental group lobbying Congress.
The environmental group lobbying Congress causes public opinion to influence policy.
The oversight committee reviewing the case implies that, if it is not the case that company Y being investigated implies it is not fined, then company Y is not cleared.
Either the oversight committee reviews the case or the oversight committee audits records.
The oversight committee auditing records entails that, should it not be true that company Y being investigated implies it is not fined, then company Y is not cleared.
The refinery being shutdown means it is not operating.
The refinery being ordered closure causes it to be shutdown.
Either construction continues or, if a stop work order is issued, construction is halted.

Either the ruling is overturned or, if it is not the case that either the developer appeals the decision or, should it not be true that the development project being proposed implies wetlands are not protected, then the development plan is modified, then the ruling is upheld.
Either the EPA regulates chemical dumping or the state agency regulates chemical dumping.
The state agency regulating chemical dumping means chemical dumping is not approved.
The EPA monitoring industrial facilities implies that, if the EPA regulates chemical dumping, then chemical dumping is not approved.
The EPA having authority for enforcement leads to the EPA monitoring industrial facilities.
Should it not be true that the development project being proposed implies it requires a permit, then the development project is not denied.
If it is not true that the development project being proposed implies wetlands are not protected, then the development plan is not modified.
In the event that it is not the case that the development project impacting habitat implies it requires a permit, then the development project is approved.
Should it not be true that company Y being investigated implies it is not fined, then company Y is cleared.

Provided that it is not true that either natural weather causes air pollution or, should industrial emissions cause air pollution, pollution levels violate standards, then the environmental group advocates for regulation.

If it is not the case that either natural weather causes air pollution or, provided that industrial emissions cause air pollution, pollution levels violate standards, then chemical dumping is approved.

Should it not be true that either natural weather causes air pollution or, if industrial emissions cause air pollution, pollution levels violate standards, then public opinion does not influence policy.

Provided that it is not true that either the developer appeals the decision or, should it not be the case that the development project being proposed implies wetlands are not protected, then the development plan is modified, then the ruling is not upheld.
Whenever it is not true that, if it is not the case that the development project being proposed implies it requires a permit, then the development project is denied, then a stop work order is issued.
Provided that it is not the case that, if pollution levels do not violate standards, then small businesses are exempt, then company X violates regulations.
Should it not be true that, should pollution levels not violate standards, then small businesses are exempt, then company Y is fined.
If it is not the case that, provided that pollution levels do not violate standards, then small businesses are exempt, then company Y is investigated.
In the event that it is not true that, if pollution levels do not violate standards, then small businesses are exempt, then company X does not violate regulations.
The coal plant not operating implies it is compliant.
